backend

Class Accounts

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.File
      • backend.user.Accounts

  • public class Accounts
extends Data
    This class represents a UserAccounts file, in memory. It inherits read and write methods from xstreambackend.Data and overrides the encode and decode methods. It has methods to add or delete a xstreambackend.User and add or remove credit from a users account. The methods provide validation in which errors are reported to caller and logged.

      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,User> users

    • Constructor Detail

      • Accounts

        public Accounts()
        default constructor for Accounts class. This constructor is mainly used for testing purposes.

      • Accounts

        public Accounts(java.lang.String readFilename,
        java.lang.String writeFilename)
        Constructor method for Accounts class. It calls the super class Data's constructor and builds the user accounts representation in memory.
        Parameters:
        readFilename - a string representing the path of the existing UserAccounts file
        writeFilename - a string representing the path to the new UserAccounts file to be written

    • Method Detail

      • newUser

        public int newUser(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String type,
          double credit)
        This method is responsible for creating a new user in memory. It validates name is not already in the system, type is a valid type, and credit does not exceed maximum or minimum. Any errors are reported back to caller.
        Parameters:
        name - a string that represents the name of xstreambackend.User
        type - a string that represents the type of user
        credit - a double that represents a xstreambackend.User's available credit.
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure, 2 on UserExistsError, 3 on on UserTypeError, 4 on UserCreditError

      • deleteUser

        public int deleteUser(java.lang.String name)
        This method is responsible for validating and deleting a user account from memory. It validates that name exists on the system and reports errors to caller. If all business constraints are met it deletes the user from memory.
        Parameters:
        name - a string that represents the name of xstreambackend.User
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure, 2 on UserDoesNotExistError

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String name)
        This method is responsible for retrieving a xstreambackend.User account from the map of accounts in the system. If user does not exist Null is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - a string that represents the name of xstreambackend.User
        Returns:
        an objects that represents a xstreambackend.User account on success, null on failure

      • decode

        public int decode(java.lang.String line)
        This method is overrides xstreambackend.Data's decode method by parsing a line of text from a file and using the values to create a user in memory. It is also responsible for validating the parsed values to ensure business constraints. An error generated by and invalid value will return a fatal error to the calling function.
        Overrides:
        decode in class Data
        Parameters:
        line - a string that represents a line from a file
        Returns:
        0 on success, 1 on failure, 2 on fatal error

      • encode

        public java.lang.String encode()
        This method overrides the encode method in backend.data. The method get the next user from the userIterator and converts its backend.data to a formatted string. name is 15 char with trailing spaces, type is 2 char, credit is 9 digits with or without decimal and leading 0's. All fields have a blank space between them. The formatted line is returned to be written to file. If end of backend.data set is reached a EOF is sent signaling calling function to finish write.
        Overrides:
        encode in class Data
        Returns:
        a string that represents a line of text to be written to file
